title: dkbit98
author: dkbit98
content: I just notice that member GodsOfSolana edited ALL of his previous messages with text ''account for sale''This shitcoiner is blatantly advertising he is selling his worthless newbie account and he is spamming forum in this process.This is GodsOfSolana account:https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=profile;u=3535503Archived posts:https://ninjastic.space/search?author=GodsOfSolanaI think he should be permanently banned from bitcointalk forum, or at least all his messages should be all deleted by moderators.I did report some of his posts but I had to create this topic to get more attention from mods and to hear oppinion from other members.Topic is self-moderated for obvious reasons.

comments.author: The Sceptical Chymist
comments.body: What a weird post history that dude has--and by that I mean his writing style is strange.  I'm not sure if those archived posts were on-topic or not, but before he edited all of them he didn't seem to be the typical bounty-hunting shitposter (although perhaps just a different breed).OP, I didn't read through every single post of his, but I didn't see any advertising or shilling in the ones that I did read.  I think this guy is a retard if he thinks anyone would buy his account, because that's not going to happen, but aside from that I don't think a ban is necessary in his case.  If the mods just wiped his post history as it stands, that would be appropriate because I'm assuming "account for sale" isn't on-topic in any of the threads those posts are in, but who knows?  The person who owns the account might want to use it again some day.Then again, if he got banned I wouldn't lose any sleep over it either.  He'd probably just come back and start up with the same shit again.

comments.author: NeuroticFish
comments.body: Quote from: The Sceptical Chymist on February 28, 2023, 07:59:03 PMbut aside from that I don't think a ban is necessary in his case.I agree to that.I would add that it may worth a negative tag for account selling, just in case only his post history gets wiped. (Edit: I've added the tag too)

comments.author: Bitcoin_Arena
comments.body: There is no strong stand from the forum administration against the sale of bitcointalk accounts if I understood that particular rule correctly;Quote from: mprep on July 21, 2014, 05:27:51 PM18. Having multiple accounts and account sales are allowed, but account sales are discouraged.So I don't think they will be banned for trying to sell their account. Maybe if they are spamming.The best we can do is tag and flag so that the account is rendered useless.

comments.author: digaran
comments.body: Don't waste your time, if mods delete his topics a lot of members will lose their weekly post counts for their campaign, maybe he wanted that to happen. Low rank accounts are not much lucrative other than the copper membership status, which anybody could just buy by themselves.It's like he decided to do a quick suicide by over reacting this way.

comments.author: John Abraham
comments.body: I guess Mods already deleted their posts. Three posts remained, and all of them were the same. Since forum rules do not forbid selling forum accounts, it isn't worth banning. I heard that even Bitcointalk Mods bought and sold forum accounts in the early days. But, when scammers started scamming using purchased forum accounts, DT members started tagging them. I guess you already know that.But my question is, what will people do with such newbie forum accounts? Anyone can create an account with an email, and it's free. If trolls and scammers want to return after getting banned, they can pay evil fees and return with a brand new account.

comments.author: GazetaBitcoin
comments.body: What intrigued me the most is what was in this guy's head. It really baffles me. So you come here on Feb 17th, you are merely a Newbie user yet 10 days later you attempt to sell your account... believing that someone will actually buy it?! Lol. Buy it for what? For having the Copper membership, which costs 0.00129002 BTC, respectively 30$? And how much was he expecting to get, anyway? I assume that by selling the account he was trying to cover his "huge loss" or a part of it. Probably he would ask for 15$ or so. Is that really an amount worth ruining your reputation new "career" on the forum?Really... I am always trying to understand people, to understand what is inside their minds, what they could possibly think when saying some things which are outrageous. But in some occasions I have absolutely no clue why someone would do a very idiotic thing, like in this case.Now his account is ruined and he paid those 30$ for absolutely nothing. Nobody will ever buy this account, not even for 1$ and the actual owner will never use it for any kind of trade, as nobody will ever trust him for anything.(P.S.: I also tagged the account.)
